Text:
ok, i know the subs are in that srt file, but how do i get the subs to show?  it plays w/o subs.
thx, be back to seed a bit more tonite.
Install VobSub and make sure the filename of the .srt file is excactly the same as the movie filename. Then VobSub will start automatically and will display the subtitles.
thx for the vobsub tip.  i installed it, but i think i need one of these first, AVISynth or VirtualDub.  can u plz tell me which of these i need as well?  i've always used vlc and powerdvd.  peace

worked like a charm, thx a million.....

wmc + vobsub = i can watch with subs !!!!  :)

great flick.
correction:   mpc + vobsub = i can watch with subs !!!!

OK, did some homework. What's in there is QPEL, whatever that is. I recompressed with VirtualDubMod, more or less as described in
http://www.divxland.org/permanentsubtitling.htm
multipass, glueing in subtitles at the same time. But divx gave poor picture with fast movements, so I did it again with Xvid. Good result, file size 623. My next computer will be in the living room ;-) Greetings, ff
